com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.common

Class ProviderSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.common.ProviderSession

  • public class ProviderSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulate UPA transport methods for the interactive provider and generic provider example applications.

    Typical usage:

    1. Call init(boolean, Error) to create a listening socket. This method initializes upaj transport and binds the server to a local port.
    2. Poll socket events from server socket using selector.
    3. If a new client session is trying to connect, accept or reject it using handleNewClientSession(Server, Error).
    4. For new request from the client, call read(Channel, Error, ReceivedMsgCallback) that initializes client socket channel to complete channel handshake and then read and processes the request sage from the client channel.

      • init

        public int init(boolean globalLock,
                com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Initializes upaj transport and binds the server to a local port.
        Parameters:
        globalLock - flag to enable global locking on UPA Transport
        error - Error information when init fails.
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes.SUCCESS if successful, TransportReturnCodes.FAILURE when bind fails.

      • handlePings

        public void handlePings()
        Handles the ping processing for all active client sessions. Sends a ping to the client if the next send ping time has arrived and checks if a ping has been received from a client within the next receive ping time.

      • setMsgSent

        public void setMsgSent(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Channel channel)
